author: A_Brickset_user
title: Small, but well tooled up
review: I'm a Space fan and don't buy much non-Space Lego, but since this comes in a twin pack (1722) with 1704 which I absolutely love to pieces, I've picked up a good couple of these too. It's a pretty good little model, little being the operative word. Still, it looks cool, tough and rugged and the neat little aerial is a nice touch. Also, plenty of tools dotted about - if I were a town collector I'd definitely want a good couple of these on my fire fighting force. I think the standard grin with eyebrows head is a bit odd though (especially for a fireman, since a job that puts you in close proximity to flames on a daily basis would more likely lead to a distinct lack of eyebrows) and, when compared to its partner, 1704, (which in my opinion shows how truly awesome TLG can make a small vehicle) the attraction of this pales somewhat. Still, a nifty little jeep well deserving of an 8.

author: hustla187
title: Fanstastic
review: This is a really good and fun set to play with. The cars Lego made back in the 90's were just awesome. The front and side of the 4x4 are really detailed and can seat a minifig which is even better. A good set to own if you are a town fan.
